purpose: Give us your feedback on the new Design Manger
text: set the channel description: Give us your feedback on the new Design Manger

Hi All. As you know, we are in-process of releasing the new Design Manager and we want to hear your feedback. This channel will be monitored by a number of HubSpotters that directly work on Design Manager and our editors, so as you encounter issues, or think of ways we can improve, please post them here.

topic: Let's talk and hear your feedback on the *new* Design Manager.
text: set the channel topic: Let's talk and hear your feedback on the *new* Design Manager.

Hey Folks, my name is Shawn Bristow and I'm the Product Manager for the Design Manager. We hope to use this channel to report feedback on the new Design Manager and Module Framework. Looking forward to hearing your feedback. If you would like access to the new tools please fill out this form and we will grant access within 24-48 hours, <http://designers.HubSpot.com/design-manager-beta>.
Is there a github repo or document somewhere we can see current bugs/issues/fixes etc
We do not allow public access to our git repo's. We also do not have a public board and likely will not be adding something like this.
Using Hubl within the css and js areas would be very useful.
Good stuff <@U38EZFVFE>. If others agree please "thumbs up" the feedback. Or expand on it via a thread....
I would love to see autoprefixing added as a checkbox to CSS files (like in codekit or prepros). This is what I see people use macros for the majority of the time.
One more thing. I always thought having emmet integrated would be bangarang.. <http://codepen.io|codepen.io> integrates it. <https://emmet.io/>
Absolutely yes, this is my most wanted thing. I currently do the html and css of modules on codepen for this very reason then pull it into the HubSpot editor because of it
.scss to .css conversion would be nice too!!
lol… that would awesome.
How about I just send over my gulp file and you guys build it into HubSpot?

It would also be great -IF this is something you guys implement, if we could put in our own filter for the prefixes (like on the autoprefixer website) <https://autoprefixer.github.io/>

We have a lot of clients that have to support a lot of old browsers.

Also side note: browser prefixes are supposed to be going away so, in say 6 years this feature may not be as necessary.
Right now we’re using data-values and hidden divs to use HubL in JS, but even that’s limited. Figured I’d share, though! Definitely would love to be able to use HubL in those areas.

While I agree with this, I see why it’s not possible yet. The problem is HubSpot wants to load the CSS and JS for each module only once. having the CSS and JS be able to be different for individual modules adds a lot of complexity to that.

If you guys can figure it out that’d be amazing though.

<@U2E6FUEEP> love the data attributes idea, we’ve done that in the past too.

Custom module instance ID’s - for example we sometimes build modules that do things like pop up a modal specific to that instance of the module, but we want the module to be able be used multiple times in a page. Right now the solution is to use HubL to generate a random number and hope that statistically all of the instances of the module will 99% of the time will never be the same.

We’ve used other methods often js based, but ultimately we’re just working around the real problem

Speaking of... has anyone else adjusted their gulpfiles in response to the Design Manager changes? I'm working on a new site now, and made some updates to allow me to mirror modules in my prototype directory. Would be interested if others are making similar changes to their workflows.
yeah it is cool hw each module sis its own folder
is its…

Hey Jon! Want to make sure I’m not missing what you’re saying, but we’ve been using `{{ parent_custom_widget_name }}` to indicate which module it’s inside of. I haven’t tested it on the new design manager yet.
Haven’t seen that variable before - does it spit out just the name of the module or does it change to be unique to each instance of the module when popped into a page :eyes:
unique instance ID
It’s a pretty awesome variable. We’ve used it in team member modules with modals.

If that’s the case you sir get all the internets this morning.:100:

<@U22PNRAJD> sorry if you’re not the right person for this - but would love this to get documented in the HuBL documentation if this does what Patrick says.

Here’s an example for you. <http://www.capstreet.com/capstreet-team>

If you open up any of the team members and inspect it, you’ll see an ID similar to ‘tmpwidget_5361183577’. That’s how we applied that token.
friggin sweet. That’s exactly what I’ve been wanting
One thing I haven’t vocalized here is the ability to set a custom module as a usable field within another custom module. That way we could use a multi-field module as a repeater field.

I don’t know if it’s still hapenning but I did notice in the page editor when moving a custom module sometimes it shows a drop region within another custom module.(never actually tried to nest them like that, but it might be worth trying)
Hmm, I’m not replicating that. Just the ability to group it. I’m working on making a custom module be the equivalent of a flex column for use with a repeating custom module.

Tag like filed in a custom module - a field that functions kinda like  the chosen.js select box with search or the tag field in the current blog topic picker.

The difference is the tags could maybe get linked to a HubDB.

Users using the module could add new values, and existing values would show in the dropdown.

Example use case:
Resource pages where there are buch of types of content, and we want filtering to be possible on the front end. We don’t want to limit marketers ability to name things, but we want it to be easy for them to re-use the existing names they’ve used before. We use hubl and javascript to pull the tags out - unique them and use that to create dropdowns for filters automatically.

<https://www.myknowledgebroker.com/downloads>

The current way we do it is just use a text input field and tell the marketers try to always spell your filter names the same - and we just hope they follow our advice otherwise the filters will show multiple spellings of options and things and look dumb
here is the chosen js field for example <https://harvesthq.github.io/chosen/>

minor tweak request - on mac the horizontal scroll bar in the code editor fields is very hard to click and drag because the horizontal “CSS” and “JS” draggable bars also have their resize function in the same spot practically. (no idea if this affects anyone on another OS. just a minor inconvenience I’ve noticed
Sorry not feedback but related to design mgr - Anyone know the keyboardshortcut for find and replace in the new design manager? I have tried some common keyboard shortcuts and can’t figure it out.
nvm it’s cmd+option+f on mac
Good to know!

Feedback - the find and replace tool hides itself when you click outside of the code editor - please make it NOT do this. There are times whereI often have to copy and paste from another tab or somewhere and it’s quite annoying to have to redo my find and replace again
We added some keyboard shortcut info in this doc as well if it's helpful: <http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/design-manager/reference>
Keyboard shortcut recommendation in file manager: Shift + click to select all files/modules/page templates between first and last selected (expect to work like finder on mac or explorer on PC)
Keyboard shortcut recommendation - add shortcut for publish. or maybe make hitting CMD + S twice to do it?

Linked Images in the new custom modules - the variables don’t appear to work in the css pane. <https://spin.d.pr/nAeyFc+> the variable is actually printed in the code. Don’t know if this is happening in actual pages yet - but I am seeing it in the design preview window

mixed content might be the root of the issue <https://spin.d.pr/pscJNg+>

seeing as the file is in the HS file manager, it’d be nice if it accommodated for this.
The way i see it working is that if the js or css is different it concatenates it if not it ignores it.

That would be awesome - but probably immensely challenging to prevent issues from occurring with it.  because what if only a small portion of your code actually is different, it’s going to double/tripple/quadruple up on the code that is identical, causing things to break
with CSS this isn’t really a big deal but with JS I could see some really tricky troubleshooting having to happen
This is true. We shall see.
this might open a can of worms.... but I'd prefer the indentation be 4 spaces (a single tab) rather than 2 spaces. More white space makes it easier to see where you are.
HubL in CSS and JS templates is only executed once before it is minified and pushed to the CDN. I think that would be pretty confusing in modules if it only worked the first time.
But really the constraint is it’s best practice to minify and cache the CSS/JS and you’re right that it’s not possible to do that if HubL has to be executed in it on every page load.
Of course you can put inline CSS and JS that includes HubL in the HTML/HubL section of a module.

Think i’ve suggested it in the past but would love it if the design preview  had a toggle for adding the HubSpot layout.css (the file that has the grid classes in it.) We sometimes build modules utilizing those classes and not having those get loaded in the design preview really makes the modules look wonky there

actually noticed something interesting - setup-style.css is being loaded.

Not sure what all is in there. but it added a default style for .btn-primary

Is there a way to "turn off" the resizing/compression of images or a more permanent way to prevent it from happening? I know we can add 
?noresize to the image url but as soon as the client uses the image module to change to a different image it gets compressed again. Not such a big deal necessarily on website pages but in email it ends up having pretty poor quality images.
I’m pretty certain HS would hate this but you could just write the module to add the ?noresize automatically

Adding on that there could be an alternate display for this field that is more similar to a multi-select or list of checkboxes. (like what you guys did with dropdown vs radio buttons on the choice field)

When you make a custom module a global module - it looks unprofessional/broken <https://spin.d.pr/wByGTC>
(name becomes what appears to be the module name in the database) shows “this module doesn’t have any editable options” instead of “hey this is a global module, if you edit this module here, beware it will affect every page it’s on!” [fields]

Then on submit save it should throw up a red modal saying “Are you sure you want to update this module across every page of the site?”

And there’s currently no way for the marketers to get in and update it.
you could lock it so they cant see it.
Well that’d defeat the purpose in this case. It’s intended to be a module the marketers will pop into pages (in flex columns) throughout the site.

Fair warning: be very careful staging a page (Which is using a design manager v1 template) and setting the template to a design manager v2 template. I don’t know what the issue is, but it seems to cause some pretty significant issues.
